{{Geobox|Range | name=The SÃ¼dliche Petermann Range | map= | map_size= | map_alt= | image= | image_size= | image_alt= | image_caption= | country=Norway | country1= | country_flag=true | region=Antarctica | region1= | region2= | region3= | region4= | region5= | region6= | region7= | highest= | highest_elevation_imperial= | highest_lat_d=71|highest_lat_m=46|highest_lat_s=00|highest_lat_NS=S | highest_long_d=12|highest_long_m=20|highest_long_s=00|highest_long_EW=E}} '''SÃ¼dliche Petermann Range''' (also known as '''SÃ¶re Petermannkjeda''', and '''Gory Otto Grotevolya''') is one of the [[Petermann Ranges]], trending NE-SW for 22 mi from [[Svarthausane Crags]] to [[Gneiskopf Peak]], in the [[Wohlthat Mountains]], [[Queen Maud Land]]. [[Mount Neustruyev]] (also known as '''Gora Neustruyeva''') is a 2,900 meter peak standing 5 mi NNE of Gneiskopf Peak.
== Discovery and naming == SÃ¼dliche Petermann Range was discovered and plotted from air photos by the [[Third German Antarctic Expedition]] (1938-1939), led by Capt. [[Alfred Ritscher]], which gave directional names to the eastern, middle and western units of the Petermann Ranges. This range was named Sore Petermannkjeda by [[Sixth Norwegian Antarctic Expedition]], 1956-60, because of its southern position in association with other units in the Petermann Ranges. A German form of this name has been recommended by [[US-ACAN]] to agree with spellings adopted for the aforementioned ranges.<ref>[http://geonames.usgs.gov/pls/gnispublic/ USGS GNIS: SÃ¼dliche Petermann Range]</ref>
